title: What is the difference between Earth and the Moon's gravity? How did astronauts calculate the gravity of the Moon? - Quora

response.answer_text: Gravity (or gravitational acceleration) of a body on its surface is calculated using formula g= G*M/R^2 where g=gravitational acceleration G= universal gravitational constant(6.674 30 x 10^-11 m^3kg^-1s^-2) M= mass of the body R=Radius of the body In case of the Earth, put mass of the Earth, M=5.972*10^24 kg Radius of the Earth, R=6.371*10^6 m gives g= 9.819532 m/s^2 In case of the Moon, put mass of the moon M=7.346*10^22 kg Radius of the Moon R=1.7371*10^6 m gives gravitational acceleration of the moon g= 1.624754 m/s^2

The difference between Earth’s gravity and moon’s gravity is 1/6. It was also determined that the gravity of moon is inferior than Earth because the moon is revolving around the earth and also that the mass of the earth is more than that of moon.
